New Records: KL Rahul's hundred came off merely 62 balls, the fastest World Cup century by an India batter.
Bas de Leede became the most successful Dutch bowler in the Cricket World Cup with 15 scalps, overtaking his father, Tim de Leede.
Key Match Events: Shreyas Iyer and KL Rahul added 208 runs in 128 balls for the fifth wicket, both ending with centuries.
Virat Kohli struck with his medium pace in the 25th over.
Rohit Sharma dismissed Teja Nidamanuru with his off-spin.
Kuldeep Yadav trapped Colin Ackermann leg before wicket.
Ravindra Jadeja struck off his very first ball.
Virat Kohli accounted for Scott Edwards.
Shubman Gill hit four sixes during his fifty.
Teja Nidamanuru sent back Shubman Gill with an excellent catch.
Bas de Leede dismissed Rohit Sharma, becoming the most successful Dutch bowler in the Cricket World Cup.
Roelof van der Merwe bowled Virat Kohli.
KL Rahul reached a century with consecutive sixes in the 50th over.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first.
Both sides were unchanged ahead of the final group clash in the Cricket World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's top five batters all scored in excess of fifty.
India openers were off to a characteristic aggressive start on a decent batting track in Bengaluru.
This was the first time that top four batters had reached the scores of fifty-plus in an innings of a Cricket World Cup encounter.
Netherlands players look back on their two victories and many long-lasting memories made at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
